abstract.t: This document clarifies the semantics associated with the Content-RangeHTTP header and associated Partial Content (206) response code.It specifically allows a server to produce a Content-Range responsewhose range is a subrange of the corresponding range requested using aprevious Range request. The HTTP protocol syntax is not modified.Instead, this document clarifies that a server responding to a clientrequesting a range (x-y) may respond with a range ((x+e)-(y-f)) fornonzero integers e,f such that (x+e) < (y-f). In addition, it clarifiesthe semantics of Request ranges which contain only a starting value.
